1512086039317577730.text:
day 77 of #100DaysOfCode 

- Design my blog from scratch and learn 11ty from 11ty Rocks!

Currently, it's built with Gatsby but I remember I had to rebuild it few times in 3 years.
Let's see if I can use 11ty and don't have to fix the build process for 10 or even 11 years. 😅

1511703716940120065.text:
day 76 of #100DaysOfCode

- Continued to migrate my data from static JSON file to Upstash Redis and Cloudflare Workers.

All went well, however I won't be able to use company's laptop to call these APIs anymore. They all got blocked now. (1)

It's a bit unfortunate, I have to use my personal machine only. 🥲
So I need to take a break from hdoc-tracker project until 22 April.

I think I'm gonna rebuild my blog as part of the next #100DaysOfCode project.

1511385814106001409.text:
day 75 of #100DaysOfCode

Continued with progress tracker.
- Decided to go with Upstash for storing my data and Cloudflare Workers for serving the REST API.

I'm using ioredis to connect to the db.
Really impressed by Upstash ease of use and how fast I can write the data so far.

1510962551311372291.text:
day 74 of #100DaysOfCode

- Did some research on how I should store data for my progress tracker project.
Looking for something serverless friendly.
Any suggestions? 👀

The data is a JSON file right now and it keeps growing every day.
It certainly won't scale well for R2 onwards

urls.title: web.dev
urls.description: About web.dev Take advantage of the latest modern technologies to build amazing web experiences for everyone. PageSpeed Insights PageSpeed Insights is a tool for measuring the performance and Core Web Vitals of a page with lab and field data. A case study measuring the full impact and benefits of high performance scores on Core Web Vitals. Progressive Web Apps leverage what the modern web can do. Adobe used Workbox to bring those capabilities to Adobe Experience

1505949450665357313.text:
day 64 of #100DaysOfCode

Learn more about web accessibility from this video
https://t.co/HdmBEUhBYg

I highly recommend it, especially to anyone who wants to learn more about web accessibility.

Here's a quick update for my progress tracker project.
- Improved color contrast 😉

🧵 I use VisBug to do quickly check the color contrast on my UI.
Also learn this in the process.
I've been using Vimium extension for years and never really use insert mode.

Using VisBug on top of Vimium, I think it would be nice if VisBug has keyboard shortcuts.

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/vIKTacrPYu

🧵 Turns out VisBug has keyboard shortcuts for quickly navigating to each tool.
For example, x for a11y tool, m/p for margin/padding tools, etc.

To use these VisBug shortcuts on top of Vimium, all I need to do is press i to enter insert mode (to ignore all keys)

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/4YqApkBXlS

1502321360164769798.text:
day 52 of #100DaysOfCode

After a hectic week, I'm back on my progress tracker project.

- Fixed a bug where the streak calculation for the latest one is not correct + unit tests 😉
- Use `div` tag instead of `a` tag in TweetBox component so that it won't change the URL https://t.co/vymjRBJJEU

Using div tag also improves my understanding of focus state.
There's a difference between `:focus` state and my own `.focused` class.

So TweetBox can now be navigated with `tab` key too.

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/21GdMNTb0Z

day 36 of #100DaysOfCode 

Fixed a bug in data processing script for my tracker project.
I just found that the order of reply tweets are out of place. 😅

Before and after (notice the reply tweet at day 34).

In each conversation, reply tweets should be under the top-level tweet and sorted by created_at field (oldest first).
I use OrderedDict in Python to solve this.

urls.title: Disk Usage Before Yarn Workspaces
urls.description: In my #100DaysOfCode projects, I included Tailwind CSS in many days (day 4, 5, 6, 7). This introduces node_module folders on each one of these folders with pretty much duplicate content. As you can see from the screenshots below, disk usage went down drastically. It puts all dependencies as zip files under.yarn/cache folder. As a result, my packages (day 4, 5, 6, 7, and 13) are now contain only source

1484210201456967687.text:
demo: https://t.co/5uMQD7Xggu
src: https://t.co/4Xg26G9EuC

Would love to hear some feedback.

#100DaysOfCode #JavaScript

1483838036618379264.text:
day 13 of #100DaysOfCode 

Learned about Yarn workspaces and start using it in my repo.

I deliberately use TailwindCSS as dependencies for day 4 to 7 to see how Yarn workspaces can save some disk space.

The result is truly impressive!

However, day 13 project is still WIP. https://t.co/rWwRIhdbGE

1479656311792955393.text:
Fixed a small bug in my day 5 project.

The keyboard shortcuts `ctrl k` and `cmd k` are working fine on macOS.

However, pressing `ctrl k` on Windows by default will trigger Google Search in Chrome browser.
So I need to call e.preventDefault() to prevent that 😅

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/XaoM3DUAXu
